channel.title: What forum would you prefer?
channel.description:
hello!
I was wondering what's everyone's opinion on their own very forum choice. I'm looking forward to a forum where I can get it up going with my server. The only place I've looked at was VBulletin. But i don't know how the mysql is. ( New to mysql btw) I've done the trial on Vbulletin and it looks pretty neat but how much are you paying? 20$ month, or the yearly blablabla
What's your opinion personally?

item.title: What forum would you prefer?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:34, topic:546315”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665214.msg4456963#msg4456963 date=1415466302]

I’ve never had a problem with speed, maybe it’s because I don’t use budget web hosting. You don’t have to use all of VB’s features, it’s simple to just not use whats not needed.

It’s a little over priced sure and there are better alternatives. As far as the developer is concerned, we know it’s bad. A complete novice however would love the fact it’s rich in features.

Just look at the kids who still use project insanity. Great comparison.

Lol I’ve never purchased vBulletin. It isn’t worth it. I only use it on Rune-Server and whatever site I may come across that has it. And your shit about the budget webhosting, drop it, because I know why you said it. You said it because of my topic in this section. You keep trying to think you’re superior to me, and you aren’t. You’re just a bitch. You don’t like me replying to your threads, don’t reply to me. Simple.

It’s also not a “little” over priced. It’s, in my opinion, extremely overpriced compared to the alternatives.
[/quote]
Somebody’s on their man period. I was mainly talking about justaguy comment. Didn’t even take notice of yours.
I’ll quote you, if I want your opinion on something, k? If you see me post, ignore me. I don’t want your attention.[/quote]

I actually do ignore your posts, even on my topics. Lol. There are just times it’s justified that I respond to you (i.e, now, since you’re directly talking to me).

Read full topic

item.title: What forum would you prefer?
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:30, topic:546315”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=665214.msg4456938#msg4456938 date=1415455186]

vBulletin really, really needs an upgrade and a cleaning.

So the codes a little old, and?
[/quote]
The code is old and clunky. It, in my experience, has always been slower than other forum software (SMF, IP.Board, myBB, others). They’re selling it as if it’s the best software you can get, when it’s not. Not at it’s current state.[/quote]

  • 1

vBulletin requires way more resources and comes as this giant monolithic application with more than half the things no one ever needs/uses anyway. The code is absolutely horrid compared to other open-source software such as SMF or MyBB which makes it especially hard to make packages (I’ve made atleast one for all three and vBulletin was the worst). Essentially you’re paying for the brand not for having the most efficient, fast, or reliable forum software out there.

The best part in this whole thing as that you can make a free forum software resemble vBulletin feature-wise if you try hard enough.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

TrisidiaX:

MyBB or VBulletin.

MyBB is pretty similar to vBulletin. Anyone who buys vBulletin is fucking stupid, the code is so far behind everyone else, it’s so horrendously shit that it’s funny.

SMF forever and ever

item.title: What forum would you prefer?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:24, topic:546315”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=665214.msg4456048#msg4456048 date=1414966312]

NodeBB actually looks pretty good

I just went to their “Live demo”. Yeah, no…
It’s like they’re trying to make a tile based forums… Why is everything about tiles…
Sorry but that’s just not my flavor.

You know you don’t have to use their default theme?? NodeBB is awesome.
[/quote]
No way?
I didn’t know that there were other themes.
I never even thought of that possibility.
Why would forum software allow users to create and share themes? That’d be silly.[/quote]
Lol. Ashi[size=6pt]t[/size], sometimes I really just want to hit you.

@OP, pretty much what’s been stated over and over, SMF or myBB. vBulletin is a huge waste of money and resources and is highly overrated.

Read full topic

item.title: What forum would you prefer?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

MyBB or SMF. Don’t touch IPB, too bloated for use in an environment like this and vBulletin has and always will be a code catastrophe and absolute waste of money.

If you’re feeling like being hipster and want to go with a truly superior forum software take a look at Wedge. People who used to work on SMF have been developing it for 4(?) years and it’s went to public beta. Very nice software, worth a look at least.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

fudge phpBB

nodeBB is embarrassingly superior

hate the layout though
